newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-GAYLE GOAL KNOCKS OUT HOLDERS VILLA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GAYLE GOAL KNOCKS OUT HOLDERS VILLA.

text.p: Striker Marcus Gayle earned Wimbledon an English League Cup quarter-final place for only the second time in their history with a first half goal which was enough to knock out last year's winners Aston Villa on Tuesday.
Villa, League Cup winners twice in the last three years, had dominated the first 45 minutes before Gayle turned the match around.

There looked no danger when he chased Alan Kimble's long ball a minute before the break but he held off the challenge by defender Steve Staunton to reach the by-line before flashing a left-foot shot between keeper Michael Oakes and his right-hand post.
Villa's misery was completed when England defender Gareth Southgate was stretchered away in the 82nd minute with what looked a serious knee injury.
In other League Cup fourth round matches, premier league Southampton were held 1-1 at first division Oxford while Ipswich won 1-0 at home against Gillingham.

But the headline-grabbing scoreline of the night came in an F.A. Cup first round replay where Hull striker Duane Darby scored six goals as the third division side beat non-league team Whitby 8-4 after extra time.
Darby scored three times in the first half but the northern league team were leading 4-3 before Darby struck his fourth a minute before full time to force an extra 30 minutes.
The striker added two more in extra time as Hull finally registered a comfortable win.
